title: filterreplied
author: filterreplied
content: DT will somebody tag this man still wearing the bitlucy scam signature and a avatarhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=408367

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: filterreplied on October 15, 2022, 04:50:07 AMDT will somebody tag this man still wearing the bitlucy scam signature and a avatarhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=408367Have you PMed the user about it?There are many users who do not have any idea what is going on around the forum. They don't have to. My guess is the user is not aware of anything at all, he even does not care what he have in his signature and avatar. On the other hand bitlucy site is down, I do not think there are any payment to receive too. All leads to realize only one thing which is the said user does take care of his signature and avatar space. A PM to him will not take longer time to get this removed.But from your side this does not make sense to me. Have you created this account only to accuse that user?

comments.author: Don Pedro Dinero
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on October 15, 2022, 07:47:03 AMHave you PMed the user about it?There are many users who do not have any idea what is going on around the forum. They don't have to. My guess is the user is not aware of anything at all, he even does not care what he have in his signature and avatar. moved.LMAO. I think you are right. I think we have seen this before. People wearing the signature of a campaign that has long since disappeared, for one reason or another, sometimes due to simple carelessness.Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on October 15, 2022, 07:47:03 AMBut from your side this does not make sense to me. Have you created this account only to accuse that user?What do you say? No, that's never happened in this section, LMAO.

comments.author: Awaklara
comments.body: If you look at the posting activity that the account is doing, it doesn't seem like it's always online for the forums. at least after Bitlucy's signature campaign was discontinued. he was part of the Bitlucy campaign.if you look at the news of the Bitlucy problem that warms up around June. he should still be active in the campaign. certainly not difficult to find information related to the project.OP, go and PM the account. that would be more helpful. I still doubt he doesn't know any information about Bitlucy. but looking at his activity on the forums, he only makes a few posts per month.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: Awaklara on October 15, 2022, 08:16:35 AMif you look at the news of the Bitlucy problem that warms up around June. he should still be active in the campaign. certainly not difficult to find information related to the project.I looked at his post history (latest 3 ages, starting from January this year).He is more frequent in Collectibles. Few posts in service, mostly in signature campaign application. I guess two posts in meta and few in bitcoin discussion, few in gambling boards. This is one of those users who does not have any interest of what is going on in other boards except they are regular in the board they found there place.Don't expect every single forum member to know what is going on in the community even it this is the topic of the town. They are still unaware.

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on October 15, 2022, 07:47:03 AMHave you PMed the user about it?Quote from: Awaklara on October 15, 2022, 08:16:35 AMOP, go and PM the account. that would be more helpful.By default, this setting is unchecked in the personal message options settings. It has to be manually checked by any user who wants to allow newbies to PM him or her. So in that case the OP most likely won't be able to pm FFrankie if that person doesn't manually tick his personal message options. Maybe, OP can remind FFrankie with his main account if the OP really cares.

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: Quote from: _BlackStar on October 15, 2022, 04:51:06 PMMaybe, OP can remind FFrankie with his main account if the OP really cares.Though it doesn't really matter since the site is currently offline, In good spirit, I am going to send FFrankie a PM about this if no one has done it yet. I hope it doesn't haunt me later, and I am accused of being OP's alt account

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on October 15, 2022, 08:46:40 AMQuote from: Awaklara on October 15, 2022, 08:16:35 AMif you look at the news of the Bitlucy problem that warms up around June. he should still be active in the campaign. certainly not difficult to find information related to the project.I looked at his post history (latest 3 ages, starting from January this year).He is more frequent in Collectibles. Few posts in service, mostly in signature campaign application. I guess two posts in meta and few in bitcoin discussion, few in gambling boards. This is one of those users who does not have any interest of what is going on in other boards except they are regular in the board they found there place.Don't expect every single forum member to know what is going on in the community even it this is the topic of the town. They are still unaware.Well, he signed up to promote the site through his signature. I think it would be fair to say that he has a responsibility to at least know what is going on with his current campaign. According to his post history, it seems that he knew that he no longer had to write a certain number of posts per week to meet the quota, so he may have simply forgotten to remove the ad from his signature.

comments.author: Awaklara
comments.body: Quote from: decodx on October 15, 2022, 10:19:10 PMQuote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on October 15, 2022, 08:46:40 AMDon't expect every single forum member to know what is going on in the community even it this is the topic of the town. They are still unaware.Well, he signed up to promote the site through his signature. I think it would be fair to say that he has a responsibility to at least know what is going on with his current campaign. According to his post history, it seems that he knew that he no longer had to write a certain number of posts per week to meet the quota, so he may have simply forgotten to remove the ad from his signature.that's what every campaign participant does. it is quite strange that the participant of the campaign is not aware of the case while the campaign is running and he is not paid weekly but still posting. unless he knows he won't be paid for posts that don't comply with the campaign rules.looks like JeromeTash has done well. now Frankie removed his signature and avatar.OP, you should have locked the thread.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: filterreplied on October 15, 2022, 04:50:07 AMwill somebody tag this manIf you believe someone deserves to be tagged: do it! And use your main account for it. That's how the DefaultTrust system becomes more decentralized.See LoyceV's Beginners guide to correct use of the Trust system.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: filterreplied on October 15, 2022, 04:50:07 AMwill somebody tag this man still wearing the bitlucy scam signature and a avatarIs it so hard to use your main account and tag him yourself?Instead you registered new account just to post this... sorry but this is so pathetic. I know one coward member who likes a lot tagging everyone who wears signatures he doesn't like...Quote from: LoyceV on October 16, 2022, 10:24:19 AMIf you believe someone deserves to be tagged: do it! And use your main account for it. That's how the DefaultTrust system becomes more decentralized.See LoyceV's Beginners guide to correct use of the Trust system.Some people don't like, they avoid or they are afraid of tagging members wit a lot of positive feedback or if they are DT members.No need to post begginers guide for someone who is obviously not beginner at all I don't see any signature on FFrankie profile so he probably removed it.

comments.author: borovichok
comments.body: Quote from: JeromeTash on October 15, 2022, 09:53:40 PMQuote from: _BlackStar on October 15, 2022, 04:51:06 PMMaybe, OP can remind FFrankie with his main account if the OP really cares.Though it doesn't really matter since the site is currently offline, In good spirit, I am going to send FFrankie a PM about this if no one has done it yet. I hope it doesn't haunt me later, and I am accused of being OP's alt account  Oh, I had no idea the site had gone down. I think it was the bravest thing they could have done because they were already out of finances to run a casino; I hope they get things in order before the next time. The casino operation is excessively risky; a single player may bankrupt the enterprise from the first bet slip.Quote from: dkbit98 on October 17, 2022, 06:08:27 PMQuote from: LoyceV on October 16, 2022, 10:24:19 AMIf you believe someone deserves to be tagged: do it! And use your main account for it. That's how the DefaultTrust system becomes more decentralized.See LoyceV's Beginners guide to correct use of the Trust system.Some people don't like, they avoid or they are afraid of tagging members wit a lot of positive feedback or if they are DT members.Only Pussy hides behind shadows when he sees an evident truth. I know some DT hide behind a newbies account to accuse another DT member, but hiding behind a newbies account against a non-DT member makes no sense to me.

comments.author: DireWolfM14
comments.created_time: October 17, 2022, 06:59:25 PMLast edit: October 17, 2022, 10:26:10 PM by DireWolfM14
comments.body: Someone must have notified FFrankie about the BitLucy debacle (possibly through the miracle of direct message,) and low and behold; the signature is gone.  So, now that it's done will the yellow-bellied OP please log into his alt to lock this thread?
